name: S3FileUpload
description: Upload files to an Amazon Simple Storage Service (S3) Bucket
author: Amazon Web Services
helpMarkDown: Please refer to [Working with Amazon S3 Buckets](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/UsingBucket.html)

inputs.name: awsConnection
inputs.label: AWS service endpoint
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the AWS endpoint to use. If needed, click on 'manage', and add a new Service Endpoint of type 'AWS'

inputs.name: bucketName
inputs.label: Bucket Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the bucket where the files will be uploaded. If the bucket does not exist it will be created.

inputs.name: sourceFolder
inputs.label: Source Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: The source folder that the content pattern(s) will be run against. If not set the root of the repo is assumed. Use [variables](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=550988) if files are not in the repo. Example: $(agent.builddirectory)

inputs.name: globExpressions
inputs.label: Contents
inputs.helpMarkDown: File path/name glob patterns to select the files to be uploaded. Supports multiple lines of minimatch patterns.

inputs.name: targetFolder
inputs.label: Target Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: The target folder in the S3 bucket to contain the files. If not set the root of the bucket is assumed. You can use [variables](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=550988)

inputs.name: filesAcl
inputs.label: Access Control (ACL)
inputs.helpMarkDown: The canned Access Control List (ACL) to apply to the uploaded files. Refer to [Canned ACL](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/acl-overview.html#canned-acl)

inputs.name: createBucket
inputs.label: Create S3 bucket if it does not exist
inputs.helpMarkDown: Automatically create the S3 bucket if it does not exist.

inputs.name: overwrite
inputs.label: Overwrite
inputs.helpMarkDown: Replace existing files in and beneath the target folder.

inputs.name: flattenFolders
inputs.label: Flatten folders
inputs.helpMarkDown: Flatten the folder structure and copy all files into the specified target folder in the bucket

messages.TargetIsDir: Unable to copy file %s to %s. The target path already exists as a directory.
